title: Nikolai Bodisko
text:
Nikolai Andreevich Bodisko, () (1756 – 1815) was a Russian <a href="counter%20admiral">counter admiral</a>.
Bodisko participated in the wars against <a href="Napoleonic%20France">Napoleonic France</a> before the <a href="Treaty%20of%20Tilsit">Treaties of Tilsit</a> in 1807. During the <a href="Finnish%20War">Finnish War</a> he commanded the Russian forces that landed on <a href="Gotland">Gotland</a> on 22 April 1808 and <a href="Russian%20occupation%20of%20Gotland">occupied the island</a>. When a Swedish naval force under <a href="Konteradmiral">counter admiral</a> <a href="Rudolf%20Cederstr%C3%B6m">Rudolf Cederström</a> arrived on 16 May, the Russian situation became hopeless. Bodisko capitulated and the Russian forces returned home. This was not appreciated by emperor <a href="Alexander%20I%20of%20Russia">Alexander I</a> who exiled Bodisko to <a href="Vologda">Vologda</a>. Bodisko was eventually pardoned by the emperor and became commander of the <a href="Suomenlinna">Sveaborg fortress</a> (today Suomenlinna) at <a href="Helsinki">Helsinki</a>.
